title: About
text: About this site

title: JAB Lab
text: JAB Lab focuses on understanding human cognition through rigorous experimental methods and advanced analytics. We explore questions at the intersection of cognitive psychology, neuroscience, and real-world behavior.

title: JAB Lab
text: JAB Lab focuses on understanding human cognition through rigorous experimental methods and advanced analytics. We explore questions at the intersection of cognitive psychology, neuroscience, and real-world behavior.

title: JAB Lab
text:
Research Interests

Cognitive processes in naturalistic contexts
Ecological Momentary Assessment (EMA) methodologies
Team performance and individual development
Language, memory, and motivation
Computational approaches to psychological data

title: JAB Lab
text:
About
I’m a cognitive psychologist with expertise in experimental design, statistical modeling, and data science. My work bridges laboratory research and applied settings, with a focus on capturing cognition as it unfolds in real time.
Background: - PhD in Cognitive Psychology (Cognitive Neuroscience concentration) - BA in Psychology and English Literature, Purchase College (Summa Cum Laude) - Experience in EMA research (Saul Shiffman’s lab, University of Pittsburgh) - Founder of a digital platform company using SMS-based assessment for team and individual performance
Methods & Tools: - Statistical modeling (GLM tradition) - R, Python, SAS, SPSS, SQL - Experimental design and psychometrics - Text-based data collection systems

title: Code & Tools
text:
This page showcases reusable code, analysis tools, and research utilities developed for JAB Lab projects.
All code is available on GitHub.

title: Code & Tools
text:
This page showcases reusable code, analysis tools, and research utilities developed for JAB Lab projects.
All code is available on GitHub.

title: Code & Tools
text:
Research Tools

EMA & Text-Based Assessment
Tools for ecological momentary assessment and SMS-based data collection systems.
Technologies: Python, R, SMS APIs
Status: In development



Statistical Analysis Utilities
Reusable functions for mixed models, psychometric analysis, and longitudinal data.
Technologies: R, Python (statsmodels, scikit-learn)
Status: In development



Data Visualization
Custom plotting functions and dashboard templates for research reporting.
Technologies: R (ggplot2), Python (matplotlib, plotly)
Status: In development

title: Code & Tools
text:
Example Datasets
Small, anonymized example datasets for methodological demonstrations available in the repository.

title: Projects
text:
Interactive evidence synthesis exploring ecological levels of violence Methods: Ecological Momentary Assessment, longitudinal modeling, risk assessment validation
Status: Active - Data collection and analysis ongoing
View project details




Examining perceptual and cognitive mechanisms of hallucinations across clinical and non-clinical populations. Exploring phenomenology, neural correlates, and assessment methods.
Methods: Phenomenological interviews, cognitive assessment, psychometric validation, experience sampling
Status: Active - Assessment development and validation phase
View project details




Developing and validating assessment tools for individual and team performance. Emphasis on ecologically valid measurement in applied settings.
Methods: EMA, text-based data collection, psychometric validation, team network analysis
Status: Active - Tool development and field testing
View project details
